position: Major Projects and Programs Data Science Intern
description:
Requisition ID # 83503

Job Category : Administrative / Clerical
Job Level : Individual Contributor
Business Unit: Electric Operations

Organization Overview
Major Projects and Programs (MPP) is responsible for the end-to-end project management, design, estimating and construction of all distribution and transmission projects. These projects and programs include Vegetation Management, State Infrastructure, Pole Replacement, Rule 20, Capacity/Reliability Planning, Storage, WRO, and Mobile Home. MPP is also responsible for overseeing two major programs in our wildfire risk mitigations plans, the system hardening of distribution line miles and the system inspection in high risk areas. MPP strives to deliver certainty in work execution by performing work safely, effectively and efficiently.

Position Summary :
The Engineering Planning Intern will work with the VP, Electric Program Manager Principal and the Major Project and Program leadership team to provide complex analytical, technical and administrative support to facilitate the day-to-day operation. Perform analytical and technical tasks to complete special and ongoing projects requiring extensive mathematical modeling experience, data collection and detailed analysis. The analyze will exercise independent judgment to troubleshoot and resolve issues which crosscut the organization and/or could negatively impact the ability of the organization to function effectively.

Job Responsibilities:
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize reporting
Use predictive modeling to proactively identify issues in the organization
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy

Minimum: Earning a Bachelor ’ s or Master ’ s degree in Economics, Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field (students must be continuing education towards degree during and/or after the internship)

Desired:
Ability to redefine problems to identify alternative strategies and solutions that might not be instantly apparent with our initial level of understanding.
Ability to create mathematical models to determine the correct supply to demand balance
Experience designing slide templates to convey information to a wider audience
Experience in using Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Experience using Tableau, R, JMP or similar programs
Previous graphic design experience
Exquisite attention to detail with an eye for composition, spacing, alignment, consistency, cohesion and management
Excited by working on varied tasks from day to day and can roll with the punches
Energy, enthusiasm, flexibility, hustle, hunger and an amazing attitude.
Obsessive focus on quality, details, and consistency for the best overall results.
Positive attitude and eager to solve problems with creativity
Be comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative and interdisciplinary environment, and can complete tasks with strong attention to detail
Proficient in a data analysis tools and techniques
Proficient in analyzing data and finding meaningful conclusions from data
Experience working with business teams to understand and define problems for analysis; experience dealing with ambiguous business problems and translating them into feasible analytic exercises to provide answers.
Able to take complex problems and break them down into their component parts
Comfortable in a fast-paced environment, and ideally has experience in dealing with uncertainty
Ability to gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports
Create mathematical models using linear and non-linear regression analysis,

This position will report to the Electric Program Manager Principal in MPP.

PG&E typically is unable to provide VISA sponsorship to students on an F-1, J-1 or other student visa for this position. Pacific Gas and Electric Company is an AA/EEO employer that actively pursues and hires a diverse workforce.

The Field Applications Team is responsible for solution/feature validation, implementation, and verification. We are looking for an RF Field Applications Engineering Intern to support internal validation and verification based on new features and requests.

Responsibilities:

In this role, you will:

  • Setup and Validate Litepoint IQfact+ solution on customer devices
  • Coding/Scripting under the guidance of the mentor.
  • Run regression tests on QA stations and analyze test result
  • Duplicate and debug failure issues in software and hardware.

You will gain technical expertise in wireless communications/RF, measurements and testing equipment and enhance your software development skills.

Requirements:

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science
  • Basic knowledge of wireless communications and RF
  • Familiarity with C/C++ programming
  • Excellent communication skills and strong problem solving abilities

About Litepoint

LitePoint creates wireless test solutions and services for the world’s most innovative wireless device makers, helping them to ensure their products perform for today’s demanding consumers. A leading innovator in wireless testing, LitePoint products come out of the box ready to test the most widely used wireless chipsets in the world. LitePoint works with the leading makers of smartphones, tablets, PCs, wireless access points and chipsets. LitePoint is also at the forefront of testing the burgeoning world of connected devices…the Internet of Things. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, California and with offices around the world. LitePoint is a wholly owned subsidiary of Teradyne (NYSE: TER), a leading supplier of automation equipment for test and industrial applications. In 2019, the combined corporation had revenue of $2.3 billion and employs approximately 5,500 people worldwide.

About our group:

Seagate has one simple mission: to help the world save more of its precious data. Multiple studies have shown that machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data analytics are all improved with larger data sets. These methods are what is needed for the world to solve its important challenges from developing vaccines to combating climate change to improving autonomy in driving that saves lives. Unfortunately, however, the IDC projects that 158 of the 175 predicted zettabytes of data produced in 2025 will not be saved. By lowering the cost of storage, Seagate aims to rescue as much of this at-risk 158 zettabytes as possible to provide larger data sets and correspondingly improved learning, autonomy, and analytics. To achieve this goal, Seagate is harnessing the power of open source software to reduce data center costs. Our group is dedicated to this goal.

About the role - you will:

As a Developer Advocate intern, your role will be central to this important corporate strategy as you will help create the public face of Seagate’s open source initiatives. You will interact with a community who shares this vision to deliver the world’s best overall data center storage solutions optimized for both capacity and performance. In this role, you will evangelize Seagate’s vision and open source initiatives via blog posts, hackathons, meet-ups, and code integrations with popular third-party software suites such as pytorch, Map-Reduce, Kubernetes, and Spark for example. You will work to support and learn from our full-time developer advocates and gain valuable experience as well as an understanding of whether this unique type of role is suitable for a full-time career.

No community can be successful without an inclusive culture and you will be responsible for modeling and ensuring inclusive and respectful community behaviors to promote healthy growth and nurturing of the community. Additionally, you will represent the external community in internal forums to amplify their voices and smoothly deliver their contributions and ideas appropriately within Seagate.

Interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.


About you:

  • PhD Degree (in progress) in Computer Science, Data Science or related fields
  • Currently enrolled student returning to school in fall 2021
  • Knowledge of third-party software suites such as Kubernetes, pytorch, Map-Reduce or Spark
  • Love to learn
  • Love to teach
  • Love technology
  • Love open source

About Us:

Spudnik Equipment Company LLC is the North American market leader for potato planting, harvesting, and handling equipment – all designed and manufactured in our state of the art facility in Blackfoot, Idaho. We have opportunities for enthusiastic, self-directed, and innovative people who are interested in a satisfying and rewarding career. We are now accepting applications for the following position:

POSITION: IT Specialist

LOCATION: Blackfoot, Idaho

JOB SUMMARY:

The Information Systems Technician Intern is an integral part of the support system for Spudnik Equipment Company. The Intern is responsible for providing information technology support necessary to professionally and efficiently conduct our business. Teamwork and customer service skills are vitally important as the Intern works directly and indirectly with employees, supervisors, managers, and vendors. In order to meet customer and business needs, the Intern may be required to work extended hours or additional shifts. The Technician will demonstrate high levels of responsibility and accountability, working effectively and efficiently at all times.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned as necessary

  • Actively assist Department supervisor in maintaining servers, networks, and communication systems;
  • Receive, install, track, maintain, set up, and troubleshoot hardware, software, and devices;
  • Diagnose, repair, and return failed hardware and devices to vendors to meet the needed requirements of the RMAs;
  • Manage and ensure reliable and current data backup procedures;
  • Train and assist users in performing their duties related to computer hardware, software, and various programs;
  • Review, document, and update department policies and procedures in areas such as network layout, training topics, and frequently asked questions;
  • Assist in facilities maintenance and upgrades as needed.

Additional Duties and Responsibilities
Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned as necessary

  • Work in a team environment with little or no supervision;
  • Maintain a safe, organized, and clean work environment;
  • Fill in during team member absences;
  • Promote the company’s core values; integrity, respect, commitment, quality, innovation.

Qualifications

  • At least one year of education in Information Systems Technology, Computer Science, Certification, or equivalent experience;
  • Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.);
  • Working knowledge of Active Directory;
  • Ability to effectively organize and analyze data;
  • Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot and diagnose hardware and software failures;
  • Excellent communication skills including, verbal, written, and through presentation;
  • High attention to detail;
  • Ability to maintain composure and meet deadlines while under stressful conditions.

Machines Typically Operated

  • Basic clerical machines including computer, printer, adding machine, multiline telephone system, fax machine, postal machine, etc.;
  • Using man-lifts/scissor lifts, climbing ladders

Typical Physical Requirements

Light work involving:

  • Hearing
  • Typing
  • Repetitive
  • Sitting
  • Handling
  • Standing
  • Motions
  • Sitting
  • Walking
  • Reaching
  • Lifting
  • Stooping
  • Talking
  • Grasping
  • Bending

Typical Environmental Conditions

  • Activities occur primarily inside the office with protection from weather conditions but not necessarily temperature changes. Some activities occur in a manufacturing environment working near equipment. Basic safety protocols required. High stress levels with customer expectations may occur during peak seasons.


PAY: Starting at $13.00/hr.

DEADLINE TO APPLY: Open until filled.

TO APPLY: Apply online at www.spudnik.com via the Careers page.

SPUDNIK IS A DRUG-FREE WORKPLACE

About Accelerant Agency

Accelerant Agency is a Chicago-based Digital Strategy agency that scales companies focused on growth.

*
What Accelerant Agency Does:

Accelerant’s motto is More Strategy, Less Marketing, Bigger Business. Instead of solely offering standard marketing services to companies, Accelerant instead prioritizes creating a sound, multi-channel digital strategy.
*
*
What makes Accelerant Agency different?

Accelerant isn’t your standard marketing agency, we’re a digital strategy agency. We don’t advertise, or collect business leads. Instead, we strategically and meticulously analyze certain industries for a year or longer before approaching an ideal local partner in that industry. At that point, we’ve become so knowledgeable in the field that we know which company most needs our services and the expected return a partnership will create for them.
*
*
Our Values

Think strategically

Set goals

Outwork everyone

Collaborate honestly

Celebrate often
*
*
Internship Description

The Marketing Internship at Accelerant Agency requires a growth-focused mindset and a desire to think strategically. The primary focus of this role is to give interns the opportunity to learn new skills in evolving markets and put them into practice.
*

*
What you’ll do

In the same way we adjust to our Chicagoland clients, this internship will flex to the current and desired skillset of our intern. Although a majority of this internship position will be based around WordPress Design and WordPress Development, the successful intern will take on other projects. On any given week, though, you might expect to work on projects like:
*

*

  • Web Design and development -- Whether you can hand-code or don’t even know what HTML stands for, you’ll likely learn website design 101. Accelerant’s founder has built websites for more than 20 years, and prides himself on breaking down the tech barrier to give interns a basic understanding of taking an idea from concept to public.
  • SEO and copywriting -- It’s not as daunting as it may seem. You’ll learn what Search Engine Optimization is, why it’s important, and why businesses of all sizes need it.
  • Conversion Rate Optimization -- How can you turn visitors into paying clients and customers? In this internship, you’ll learn first-hand from someone with a decade-plus experience in conversion rate optimization, a highly desired skill in today’s workplace.
  • Business intelligence and competitive analysis -- Yup. You’ll learn this in an internship. Accelerant has developed a process to identify a company’s growth potential on multiple digital platforms. You’ll learn how to spot a company’s blind spots online, and how to create opportunities to address those blind spots using enterprise-level software, tools and techniques.
  • Google Analytics and Google Ads optimization -- Google owns the internet, for better or worse. An Accelerant intern will become well-versed on all of Google’s products, including Analytics, Ads, Search Console, Tag Manager and others.

*
*
Qualifications

  • Experience in WordPress design or WordPress development
  • Basic understanding of digital marketing
  • Desire to pursue a career in Web Design, Communications, Advertising, Sales, Journalism, Public Relations, Marketing, computer science, Information Technology, Internet Marketing, Data Analytics, Data Science or related fields
  • Growth-mindset and eagerness to learn
  • Ability to have a ton of fun while doing the above

*
*
Perks + Pay

  • Opportunity to work with industry professionals and experienced marketers
  • Ongoing training and personal instruction from Accelerant team members, partner creatives, and specialized online courses
  • Monthly stipend based on hours worked
  • Portfolio piece opportunities with real clients

*

The Texas Comptroller of Public Accounts was recently named #8th best places to work in Austin by the Austin American Statesman. Come intern with our organization and see why our team is so proud to serve our fellow Texans!

The Texas Comptroller of Public Accounts manages funds for the world’s 11th largest economy, processes millions of paper and electronic tax returns each year and continually searches for innovative solutions to streamline operations at one of Texas’ largest state agencies. The Comptroller is the chief steward of the state’s finances, acting as tax collector, chief accountant, chief revenue estimator and chief treasurer for all of state government, in addition to administering a number of other programs.

Your Career Matters
Our team is made up of a diverse and dedicated group of people who know they come to work and make a difference. We have a workforce with expertise in areas such as tax policy, law, auditing, criminal investigations, communications and more. And, our agency strongly encourages both professional and personal growth. At the Texas Comptroller’s office, you’ll find:

  • Work-life balance * Competitive salaries * Professional career training * Leadership development * Opportunities for career growth

DIVISION: Information Technology

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
Performs basic (entry-level) through complex (journey-level) cybersecurity analysis work. Work involves protecting cybersecurity assets and delivering cybersecurity incident detection, incident response, threat assessment, cyber intelligence, software security, and vulnerability assessment services. Students will engage in work activities under the direction and mentoring of the Security and Data Operations Division.

WORK HOURS:
The position works an eight-hour schedule between 7:00 am and 6:00 pm, 40-hour week, Monday – Friday with occasional work schedule variance as necessary. Occasionally work overtime and/or additional hours. Hours may change based on business need.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Monitors and analyzes cybersecurity alerts from cybersecurity tools, network devices, and information systems.
  • Monitors and maintains cybersecurity infrastructure and/or policies and procedures to protect information systems from unauthorized use.
  • Monitors network traffic and flow for analysis.
  • Supports cybersecurity incident detection, analysis, and prevention.
  • Supports vulnerability scans of networks and applications to assess effectiveness and identify weaknesses.
  • Researches and analyzes cybersecurity threat indicators and their behaviors and recommends threat mitigation strategies.
  • Researches cybersecurity and privacy legislation, regulations, advisories, alerts, and vulnerabilities.
  • Evaluates network and system security configuration for best practices and risk-based access controls.
  • Assists in identifying and evaluating new cybersecurity technologies to remediate vulnerabilities.
  • Assists in advising management and users regarding security procedures.
  • Assists in implementing and maintenance of enterprise security systems including Anti-Virus, DLP, SIEM systems, vulnerability scanners and security information management tools.
  • Assists in implementing and maintenance of security controls for infrastructure systems including servers, workstations, web and other applications.
  • Support incident response activities including coordination of immediate corrective action to systems known to have any security weaknesses or vulnerabilities, including network isolation, re-configuration and installing appropriate patches or upgrades
  • Troubleshoots basic systems problems related to network, security, infrastructure and application information systems
  • Monitor sources of information on potential threats and vulnerabilities, including hacker web sites, anti-virus vendors, other government agencies and trade publications.
  • Performs related work as assigned.

*

Qualifications*
EDUCATION:
Currently enrolled as a Junior or Senior at an accredited college or university, or recently graduated within the past 6 months

PREFERRED EDUCATION:
Enrolled in an accredited college or university with a degree plan in in cybersecurity, information technology security, computer engineering, computer information systems, computer science, management information systems

EXPERIENCE:
Professional or academic experience in cybersecurity analysis, information security analysis, or digital forensics

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

  • experience supporting Anti-Virus, DLP & SIEM, systems scanning, application scanning, Windows, Linux and Unix systems.
  • experience analyzing security events
  • experience supporting complex networks

LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS:
Security+ or GCIA is preferred

Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

SUMMARY
ANSYS empowers the world's most innovative companies to design and deliver transformational products by offering the best and broadest engineering simulation software to solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Thus, through our enriching co-op program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists.

Co-ops alternate between school and full-time work assignments each semester. You will test our industry-leading simulation software while gaining real experience in your field of study. Each semester builds upon the foundational learning that prepares you for more advanced problem solutions. You will support one of our business units, including but not limited to the following:
  • Design Business Unit
  • Platform Development Unit
  • Licensing & Install Unit
  • Mechanical Business Unit
  • Release Management Unit

This co-op is a 40-hour per week paid position starting January 2021 and concluding April 2021.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Work alongside the department's testing team to conduct interactive and regression tests.
  • Write scripts to run testing responsibilities via automated tests
  • Analyze results, log and retest found bugs.
  • Improve the efficiency and accuracy of Ansys products.
  • Oversee testing tools that help manage and evaluate product quality.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Pursuing a BS in Mechanical engineering, Electric engineering, AEM, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related technical degree with a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
  • Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to university after the completion of the co-op program.
  • Dedication to three (3) semester rotations for Engineers.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Exposure to programming using Python, C++, C#, or Java is a plus.
  • Exposure to CAD and/or FEA.
  • Exposure to Windows/Linux systems.
  • Experience with Ansys products.
  • Sharp and tenacious problem-solving skills.

CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
  • Customer focus
  • Results and Accountability
  • Innovation
  • Transparency and Integrity
  • Mastery
  • Inclusiveness
  • Sense of urgency
  • Collaboration and Teamwork


WORKING AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

position: Computer Vision and Machine Learning Research Internship
description:

A leading global healthcare company, Siemens Healthineers continues to strengthen our portfolio of medical imaging and laboratory diagnostics, while adding new offerings such as managed services, consulting, and healthcare IT services – as well as further technologies in the growing market for therapeutic and molecular diagnostics.

Siemens Healthineers develops innovations that support better patient outcomes with greater efficiencies, giving providers the confidence, they need to meet the clinical, operational and financial challenges of a changing healthcare landscape. position: University Relations - Cybersecurity / Cyber Defense Security Intern - Richardson/Chicago
company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of IL, MT, NM, OK & TX
description:
Why Intern at Health Care Service Corporation?

Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), a Mutual Legal Reserve Company and an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. HCSC affiliates and subsidiaries such as Dearborn National®, TMG Health and Medecision, offer group life, disability and dental solutions, as well as a range of other individual solutions. The company, founded in 1936, serves nearly 15 million members across five states and employs more than 21,000 people in over 60 local offices. HCSC is dedicated to expanding access to high quality, cost effective health care and equipping our members with information and tools so they can make the best health care decisions for themselves and their families. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. Today, we are leaders in the development of value-based care models to spur greater collaboration and accountability among various stakeholders to improve the health care experience for patients and consumers and enable them lead healthier lives.

** This ten-week paid internship can be located in Richardson, TX OR Chicago, IL. **

What Are Your Responsibilities?

– Collecting and developing metrics on cyber security incidents and producing
charts and tables for reporting purposes
– Interviewing cyber defense team members, capturing and documenting processes and developing flowcharts of process decision points and interaction
– Installing and evaluating cyber security tools and performing proof of concept analysis for cyber defense
– Leveraging common attack frameworks and developing attacker kill chains and measuring defensive capabilities to defend same

– Researching cyber attacks and cyber threats

– Prior Internship experience with Cybersecurity, Information Security or other IT disciplines is a plus
– Curiosity around new and emerging technology and stays informed and connected with other like-minded individuals
– Capable of doing independent research

– Knowledge of or experience with databases, coding or project management is a plus
– Eagerness to learn, grow and contribute
– Strong knowledge of technology and internet search engines
– Ability to use virtual machines, OS installation and installing and configuring software packages
– Demonstrated interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication
– Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
– Practical, developed PC skills, especially Excel, Word, and Access and virtual team collaboration tools

What Are the Requirements You Must Meet?

– Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Cybersecurity, MIS, IT, Computer Science, Information Security or other related technical degree
– Graduation date between December 2021 – June 2022
– A minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0
– Availability to work 10 weeks during the summer

What Does the Internship Program Entail?

– Formal Intern Orientation to build business and industry acumen

The Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA), Office of Intergovernmental Support and Coordination for Sustainable Development (OISC)/Non-Governmental Organizations Branch (NGO) internship is for two months, with an opportunity for an extension up to maximum of six (6) months, depending on the needs of the Division.

The NGO Branch of DESA serves as the Secretariat of the Committee on NGOs and reviews all the documentation submitted to it. The Branch also provides secretariat support to ECOSOC when it considers the report of the NGO Committee. In addition, the Branch assists NGOs in their interaction with ECOSOC and other intergovernmental bodies and guides them on the use of their consultative status in order to make significant contributions to the work of the UN.

For more information about the Office, please see https://www.un.org/ecosoc/en

The internship is UNPAID and full‐time. Interns work five days per week (35 hours) under the supervision of a staff member in the department or office to which they are assigned.

Responsibilities
The Intern will support activities related to the maintenance of IT platforms used by the NGO Branch including the integrated Civil Society Organizations (iCSO) database, the NGO Branch website as well as outreach and communications with NGOs. Under the direct supervision of the Information Systems Officer and the internship coordinator the intern will be assigned the following tasks:

  • Assist in the management of content and data of the NGO Branch website and IT applications;
  • Assist in information outreach activities including dissemination of information, flyers, and preparation of periodic newsletters;
  • Support activities related to NGO registration and participation to events/meetings;
  • Assist in other IT functions as necessary including user support, ticket creation, quality control and testing of updates and features;
  • Perform other duties as required.
Competencies
The United Nations Core Competencies include:

  • Planning and Organization: Develops clear goals that are consistent with agreed strategies; Identifies priority activities and assignments; Adjusts priorities as required; Allocates appropriate amount of time and resources for completing work; Foresees risks and allows for contingencies when planning; Monitors and adjusts plans and actions as necessary; Uses time efficiently.

  • Creativity: Actively seeks to improve programmes or services; Offers new and different options to solve problems or meet client needs; Promotes and persuades others to consider new ideas; Is not bound by current thinking or traditional approaches.

  • Technological awareness: Keeps abreast of available technology; Understands applicability and limitations of technology to the work of the office; Shows willingness to learn new technology. Understands the importance of science and technology in a disarmament context.

The intern is expected to:
  • Have a demonstrated keen interest in the work of the United Nations and a personal commitment to the ideals of the United Nations Charter; and
  • Have a demonstrated ability to successfully interact with individuals of different cultural backgrounds and beliefs, which includes willingness to try and understand and be tolerant of differing opinions and views.
Education

To qualify for an internship with the United Nations Internship Programme, the following conditions must be met:
(a) be enrolled in a graduate school programme (second university degree or equivalent, or higher); or
(b) be enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (minimum Bachelor's level or equivalent); or
(c) have graduated with a university degree (as defined above) and, if selected, must commence the internship within a one year period of graduation

Applicants must be computer literate in standard software applications.

For this internship, studies in information technology, computer science or equivalent are required. Knowledge of Drupal, WordPress, Lyris, SQL/Oracle and Gitlab is desirable.

Work Experience

No working experience is required to apply for the United Nations Internship Programme. Your training, education, advance course work or skills should benefit the United Nations during your internship.

Languages

English and French are the working languages of the United Nations Secretariat. Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian and Spanish are the official languages of the United Nations Secretariat. Fluency in spoken and written English is required for participation in the Internship Programme. Knowledge of French is an asset.

Assessment

Potential candidates will be contacted by hiring manager directly for further consideration.

Special Notice
A completed online application (Cover Note and Personal History Profile) is required. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.
The Cover Note must include:
  • Degree Programme (What are you currently studying?)
  • Graduation Date (When will you graduate or when did you graduate from the programme?)
  • List the IT skills and programmes that you are proficient in.
  • List your top three areas of interest.
  • Explain why you are the best candidate for this specific internship.
  • Explain your interest in the United Nations Internship Programme.

In your online Personal History Profile, be sure to include all past work experiences, IT skills, and three references.
Due to the high volume of applications received, ONLY successful candidates will be contacted.

G-4 VISAS FOR INTERNS:
All interns assigned to a UN Organization, including Funds and Programmes, at a United States based duty station, who are not United States citizens or United States legal permanent residents (LPR) will be required to obtain G-4 visas prior to travelling to the United States.

Prospective interns who are already in the United States in another nonimmigrant status may need to apply for a change of status to G-4 prior to joining the United Nations for an internship. It should be emphasized that prospective interns are responsible for ensuring that they have an appropriate valid visa and employment authorization allowing them to undertake the internship.

If the applicant is in F-1 status and has a valid EAD, they may undertake an internship within the scope of their F-1 visa without seeking a change of visa status. Please note, however, that interns in F-1 status who wish to undertake an internship following completion of their academic programme as part of Optional Practical Training (OPT) ‘may’ need to seek a change of visa status to G-4 (This process currently takes about 8-10 weeks) or obtain G-4 visa overseas.

To qualify for G-4 nonimmigrant status, interns must be serving essentially full-time, i.e. 35 + hours per week.

REMOTE INTERNSHIP (COVID-19):
In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, applicants may be requested to undertake the internship remotely in view of constraints regarding visa issuance, international travel and access to UN premises. Applicants must be willing and prepared to undertake the internship remotely for a part or the entirety of the internship.

.

United Nations Considerations

According to article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter of the United Nations, the paramount consideration in the employment of the staff is the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. Candidates will not be considered for employment with the United Nations if they have committed violations of international human rights law, violations of international humanitarian law, sexual exploitation, sexual abuse, or sexual harassment, or if there are reasonable grounds to believe that they have been involved in the commission of any of these acts. The term “sexual exploitation” means any actual or attempted abuse of a position of vulnerability, differential power, or trust, for sexual purposes, including, but not limited to, profiting monetarily, socially or politically from the sexual exploitation of another. The term “sexual abuse” means the actual or threatened physical intrusion of a sexual nature, whether by force or under unequal or coercive conditions. The term “sexual harassment” means any unwelcome conduct of a sexual nature that might reasonably be expected or be perceived to cause offence or humiliation, when such conduct interferes with work, is made a condition of employment or creates an intimidating, hostile or offensive work environment, and when the gravity of the conduct warrants the termination of the perpetrator’s working relationship. Candidates who have committed crimes other than minor traffic offences may not be considered for employment.

Due regard will be paid to the importance of recruiting the staff on as wide a geographical basis as possible. The United Nations places no restrictions on the eligibility of men and women to participate in any capacity and under conditions of equality in its principal and subsidiary organs. The United Nations Secretariat is a non-smoking environment.

The paramount consideration in the appointment, transfer, or promotion of staff shall be the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. By accepting an offer of appointment, United Nations staff members are subject to the authority of the Secretary-General and assignment by him or her to any activities or offices of the United Nations in accordance with staff regulation 1.2 (c). In this context, all internationally recruited staff members shall be required to move periodically to discharge new functions within or across duty stations under conditions established by the Secretary-General.

Applicants are urged to follow carefully all instructions available in the online recruitment platform, inspira. For more detailed guidance, applicants may refer to the Manual for the Applicant, which can be accessed by clicking on “Manuals” hyper-link on the upper right side of the inspira account-holder homepage.

The evaluation of applicants will be conducted on the basis of the information submitted in the application according to the evaluation criteria of the job opening and the applicable internal legislations of the United Nations including the Charter of the United Nations, resolutions of the General Assembly, the Staff Regulations and Rules, administrative issuances and guidelines. Applicants must provide complete and accurate information pertaining to their personal profile and qualifications according to the instructions provided in inspira to be considered for the current job opening. No amendment, addition, deletion, revision or modification shall be made to applications that have been submitted. Candidates under serious consideration for selection will be subject to reference checks to verify the information provided in the application.

Job openings advertised on the Careers Portal will be removed at 11:59 p.m. (New York time) on the deadline date.

No Fee

THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS (APPLICATION, INTERVIEW MEETING, PROCESSING, OR TRAINING). THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CONCERN ITSELF WITH INFORMATION ON APPLICANTS’ BANK ACCOUNTS.

Performs basic (entry-level) through complex (journey-level) cybersecurity analysis work. Work involves identifying confidential and sensitive data to prevent unauthorized disclosure, protecting cybersecurity assets and data, and developing cybersecurity reports to document analysis. May train others to repeat analytical queries to ensure program stability. Students will engage in work activities under the direction and mentoring of the Information Security Division.

position: Major Projects and Programs Data Science Intern
description:
Requisition ID # 83503

Job Category : Administrative / Clerical
Job Level : Individual Contributor
Business Unit: Electric Operations

Organization Overview
Major Projects and Programs (MPP) is responsible for the end-to-end project management, design, estimating and construction of all distribution and transmission projects. These projects and programs include Vegetation Management, State Infrastructure, Pole Replacement, Rule 20, Capacity/Reliability Planning, Storage, WRO, and Mobile Home. MPP is also responsible for overseeing two major programs in our wildfire risk mitigations plans, the system hardening of distribution line miles and the system inspection in high risk areas. MPP strives to deliver certainty in work execution by performing work safely, effectively and efficiently.

Position Summary :
The Engineering Planning Intern will work with the VP, Electric Program Manager Principal and the Major Project and Program leadership team to provide complex analytical, technical and administrative support to facilitate the day-to-day operation. Perform analytical and technical tasks to complete special and ongoing projects requiring extensive mathematical modeling experience, data collection and detailed analysis. The analyze will exercise independent judgment to troubleshoot and resolve issues which crosscut the organization and/or could negatively impact the ability of the organization to function effectively.

Job Responsibilities:
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize reporting
Use predictive modeling to proactively identify issues in the organization
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy

Minimum: Earning a Bachelor ’ s or Master ’ s degree in Economics, Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field (students must be continuing education towards degree during and/or after the internship)

Job Description:

Leidos is seeking a Software Engineer Intern who will be a member of a dynamic team working on the Federal Aviation Administration's En-Route Automation Modernization ERAM) technology, which is the heart of the Next Generation Air Transportation System and the pulse of the National Airspace System helping to advance our transition from a ground-based system of air traffic control to a satellite-based system of air traffic management. ERAM is vital to the future of air navigation, providing the foundational platform required for FAA to enable NextGen solutions, via modernization programs such as System Wide Information Management, Data Communications, and Automatic Dependent Surveillance- Broadcast. ERAM will provide benefits for users and the flying public by increasing air traffic flow.

Primary Responsibilities

Take direction from management and senior developers.

Software development both individually and collaboratively in support of the mission of the ERAM program.

Modernizing the AT control system by improving the availability and performance of the ERAM system.

Supporting ERAM as it continues to migrate ERAM from the AIX operating systems to Linux.

Developing and maintaining software tools and utilities used by the broader development team.

Coordinate Solutions with Systems Engineering

Basic Qualifications

Candidate enrolled in Computer Science or Computer Engineering Program with the intention of obtaining a 4-year degree.

Candidate must be enrolled in a degree program or equivalent experience and less than 2 years prior relevant experience.
Excellent communication, interpersonal, analytical, and written skills
Self-Starter and ability to multitask

A strong desire to learn

Your GPA needs to be included on your application and resume.

US Citizenship Requirements

Candidate must be able to obtain an SF-85P Public Trust clearance from the FAA customer.

Preferred Qualifications

Detailed knowledge of Linux OS and OS concepts desirable.

Previous Programming Experience via internship, robotics club, or other education activities desirable.

Job Description:

Leidos is seeking a talented and highly motivated technical intern to join the engineering team at our Lynnwood, WA facility. The individual will support a team that’s executing multiple contracts and research activities to develop and field maritime sensors, payloads, and supporting infrastructure for next generation unmanned underwater vehicle (UUV) systems. Primary Responsibilities

This internship will support hardware development and testing for advanced projects. The selected canidate will be expected to become familiar with standard practices for assembling, designing, and testing electromechanical systems. This intern will primarily be involved with generating and maintaining electrical drawings for parts and assemblies related to programs currently underway.   • Experience working on electrical or mechanical assemblies.

  • Ability to plan, prioritize and organize work without close supervision.

  • Competent in use of Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Microsoft Project, and Visio

  • Adaptability to new challenges with a strong motivation to grow and learn in new areas

  • US citizenship is required.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in one of the following is helpful, but not required: surface or underwater vehicles, game theory, cybersecurity, autonomy, environmental modeling, simulations or communication protocols, human factors, or user interface development.

  • Software development or integration skills using Linux

  • Set up, install, repair and maintain a variety of engineering equipment

  • Make simple tracings, diagrams and drawings

  • Experience using engineering tools such as Altium, SolidWorks, SPICE, etc.…

Description

Job Description:

Leidos is seeking a Information Assurance Intern in Arlington, VA.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
The Information Assurance intern will be exposed to the two major roles in information assurance, Information Assurance Manager and Information Assurance Technician.


IAM - Responsible for developing effective initiatives for information assurance and management options. They manage information professionals to measure risks and vulnerabilities. In addition, they are in charge of reporting different compliance issues, verification processes, and policy violations.

IAT - Support, monitor, test, and troubleshoot hardware and software IA problems pertaining to their computing environment (CE). Install and operate the IT systems in a test configuration manner that does not alter the program code or compromise security safeguards.

Enterprise IA Team Support - Assist with maintaining the corporate Information Assurance resources.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of systems, networks, and data through the planning, analysis, development, implementation, maintenance, and enhancement of information systems security program, policies, procedures, and tools;
  • Providing technical advice, guidance and administering information technology (IT) principles, methods, and security products to protect and maintain the availability, integrity, confidentiality, and accountability of information system resources;
  • Implementing and advising on IT security policies and procedures to ensure the protection of information transmitted through the use of Local Area Networks (LAN) and Wide Area Networks (WAN);
  • Installing, operating, maintaining, configuring, testing and securing various operating systems and; conducting risk analysis security testing and certification of modifications or changes to computer systems.
  • Assist in the system security authorization processes.
  • Assist in writing and developing System Security Plans (SSPs), Plan of Actions and Milestones (POA&Ms), Risk Assessments, Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs), and supporting documentation for systems subject to NIST SP 800-53.
  • Implement applicable patches including IA vulnerability alerts (IAVA), IA vulnerability bulletins
  • (IAVB), and technical advisories (TA) for the CE operating system(s).
  • Support, monitor, test, and troubleshoot hardware and software anomalies. Install and operate the IT systems in a test configuration manner that does not alter the program code or compromise security safeguards.
  • Install, test, maintain, and upgrade network operating systems software and hardware to comply with IA requirements.
  • Work with other privileged users to jointly solve IA problems.
  • Management of SharePoint collaboration environments.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Currently pursuing a BS degree in Information Technology, Management or Cybersecurity or a related field with a minimum 3.0 GPA.
  • Ability to work in a group environment.
  • U.S. Citizenship is required.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Security + certification
  • A+ certification

Job Description:

Leidos is seeking candidates for a Systems Integration Engineer for a mission critical program in Chantilly, VA. The Integration Engineer will apply technical knowledge and project management skills to integrate external programs with our services. The ideal candidate will enjoy learning new concepts and technologies, having a desire to take ownership for successfully integrating clients with our system.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Leverage your technical experience to understand a client’s functional goals and translate them into technical requirements. Expand your industry knowledge to include new concepts and technologies as our program evolves, and our client list expands
  • Leverage your project management skills to manage a client’s integration with us. Independently help clients identify the next steps to move their integration project forward. Reinforce SDLC best practices through a methodical approach to transition clients from development, test, into operational environments
  • Use your communication skills to explain to clients how their systems can integrate with ours. Advise clients on recommended integration methods
  • Using your attention to detail, follow standard procedures to configure our system to integrate with the client. Recognize when the client requires customizations to a standard solution
  • Confirm the integration satisfies the client requirements by performing standard tests, investigating and troubleshooting as needed. Take ownership to troubleshoot integration issues until finding a resolution

Basic Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree program in Engineering, Computer Science or a related major.
  • System integration or software development, and experience integrating services from different systems
  • Working across teams, to collect and translate requirements into actionable tasks
  • Software testing or validation procedures, improving the procedures as needed
  • Troubleshooting software issues, investigating root causes, and recommending fixes
  • Using a command line interface to navigate Linux or Windows operating systems
  • Coordinating activities of an external group
  • Demonstrated ability to learn and apply new concepts and technologies
  • Strong problem-solving and excellent written and oral communication skills
  • US Citizenship required per contract
  • Eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI clearance. No clearance is required to start; chosen candidates will be screened for eligibility.

Preferred Qualifications

  • System administration skills in support of RHEL, SE Linux, Solaris, Windows, Apache, IIS
  • Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC), Scrum, and Agile processes
  • Knowledge of Oracle Identity and Access Management (IdAM) suite, including OAM, OID, OVD, OHS
  • Knowledge of authentication standards using OAuth, SAML, and PKI

For 40 years, the Mercatus Center at George Mason University has been the world’s premier university source for market-oriented ideas—bridging the gap between academic ideas and real-world problems. Description

Naval Nuclear Laboratory has internship opportunities for college students to spend the summer of 2022 getting great work experience, in great locations, supporting the world's greatest navy.

NNL Summer Technical Internships offer you an immersive professional experience in your field of study. You have the opportunity to work directly with world class engineers, scientists, researchers, and technicians who will provide you with real-world experience and mentorship. We work with state-of-the-art techniques researching and developing new technologies and concepts; designing and testing software, components or integrated systems; developing models and performing data analysis; supporting operations and developing process controls and procedures. At NNL you are a part of a team working on deliverables that have a direct impact on the Navy’s nuclear fleet.

  • Final presentation to management, peers, and other NNL employees

Drive global technology

position: Electric Dispatch & Scheduling Data Science Intern
description:
Requisition ID # 80851

Job Category : Administrative / Clerical
Job Level : Individual Contributor
Business Unit: Electric Operations

Organization Overview
The men and women of Electric Operations ensure the delivery of safe and reliable electric service to our customers. Electric Operations is responsible for every aspect of PG&E's electric distribution and transmission operations, including planning, engineering, maintenance and construction, asset management, business planning, restoration and emergency response.

Position Summary :
The Dispatch & Scheduling Intern will work with the Electric Dispatch & Scheduling leadership team to provide complex analytical, technical and administrative support to facilitate the day-to-day operation. Perform analytical and technical tasks to complete special and ongoing projects requiring extensive mathematical modeling experience, data collection and detailed analysis. The analyze will exercise independent judgment to troubleshoot and resolve issues which crosscut the organization and/or could negatively impact the ability of the organization to function effectively.

Job Responsibilities: Develop key metrics and dashboards used to run the business. Perform data analysis that support critical product and business decisions such as emergency response, dispatch and response times.

Minimum: Earning a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in economics, engineering, business, computer science, mathematics or related field (students MUST be continuing education towards degree during and/or after internship)

Desired:
Proficient in a data analysis tools and techniques
Proficient in analyzing data and finding meaningful conclusions from data
Experience working with business teams to understand and define problems for analysis; experience dealing with ambiguous business problems and translating them into feasible analytic exercises to provide answers.
Able to take complex problems and break them down into their component parts
Comfortable in a fast-paced environment, and ideally has experience in dealing with uncertainty
Ability to gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports
Create mathematical models using linear and non-linear regression analysis
Ability to redefine problems to identify alternative strategies and solutions that might not be instantly apparent with our initial level of understanding.
Ability to create mathematical models to determine the correct supply to demand balance
Experience designing slide templates to convey information to a wider audience
Experience in using Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Experience using Tableau, R, JMP or similar programs
Previous graphic design experience
Exquisite attention to detail with an eye for composition, spacing, alignment, consistency, cohesion and management
Excited by working on varied tasks from day to day and can roll with the punches
Energy, enthusiasm, flexibility, hustle, hunger and an amazing attitude.
Obsessive focus on quality, details, and consistency for the best overall results.
Positive attitude and eager to solve problems with creativity
Be comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative and interdisciplinary environment, and can complete tasks with strong attention to detail

This position will report to the Director of Electric Dispatch & Scheduling

PG&E typically is unable to provide VISA sponsorship to students on an F-1, J-1 or other student visa for this position. Pacific Gas and Electric Company is an AA/EEO employer that actively pursues and hires a diverse workforce.

Software Engineering Intern

The software engineer intern will assist in development projects to support our various teams across products, construction projects and manufacturing. A successful intern will be creative, take initiative, is able to be self-directed and able to adjust to an ambiguous environment.     • Front end web and mobile applications for control and display of information related to the full-stack processes.

  • Strong GPA
  • Willingness to learn
  • Resourceful and team-oriented problem-solving skills
  • Forward thinking with strong interpersonal skills
  • Display a passion for innovation

NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES:
Please note that KATERRA does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, KATERRA will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, KATERRA explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of KATERRA.

position: Disney Gift Card Services Project Analyst Intern, Summer/Fall 2021
description:

Disney Gift Card Services, Inc. is an enterprise entity responsible for creating, launching and maintaining Gift Card and Stored Value Products sold and distributed globally through a variety of channels, including online, corporate sales, retail stores and other partnerships. The team consists of Program Development, Business Development, Brand Management/Marketing, Operations, Finance and Guest Service groups dedicated to enhancing the Guest experience, reducing payment friction and supporting Walt Disney Company business initiatives.

Responsibilities:

The Project Analyst Intern will play an integral role in various project deliverables assisting and supporting the Disney Gift Card Services Program Development team. This individual will be responsible for supporting the team with tasks including, but not limited to, reporting on project statuses and updates, documentation, platform testing, Cast Member training and troubleshooting. They will partner with technical, financial, creative and operational teams at various levels to gather and provide requirements for projects and process improvements. Additionally, the intern will be responsible for sustainment activities including, but not limited to, managing system access, troubleshooting and system testing. This position may require flexible hours to support weekend & after-hours initiatives.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated strong organizational and time management skills to prioritize multiple competing priorities with attention to detail
  • Demonstrated critical thinking, creative solutioning and decision-making skills
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and build relationships with internal and external partners at various levels
  • Ability to work both independently and within a collaborative team environment
  • Ability to adapt communication styles for technical and non-technical partners
  • Demonstrated ability to handle confidential information
  • Desire to take creative, thoughtful risks in line with business needs
  • Familiar and engaged with emerging technologies
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and presentation software
  • Ability to analyze and synthesize metrics across multiple platforms to create stories depicting product performances and user experiences


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Understanding of cloud environment and database structure
  • Basic understanding of Private/Public APIs and JSON messaging
  • Knowledge of user interface/experience trends and strategies
  • Familiar with contactless consumer experiences


Required Education

Powered by endlessly curious people with an unwavering mission focus, Ball Aerospace pioneers discoveries that enable our customers to perform beyond expectation and protect what matters most.


We create innovative space solutions, enable more accurate weather forecasts, drive insightful observations of our planet, deliver actionable data and intelligence, and ensure those who defend our freedom go forward bravely and return home safely.


The Operations Strategic Support Unit plays a fundamental role in enabling efficient business and program execution – from technologies and investments to supply chain, manufacturing and test operations, facilities management, and information technology services.


The Ball Aerospace Internship Program is a 10-week summer program that provides interns with practical experience working on relevant projects while working with designated mentors; access to state-of-the-art equipment; a competitive wage; relocation reimbursement; in-house training; group activities; possible future employment and the ability to participate in the Ball Aerospace Remote Sensing Team (BIRST) program to build and launch a rocket or high-altitude balloon. At the conclusion of your internship, you will be required to prepare and deliver a formal presentation of your project work to your respective department.


Technical Intern - Data Analyst


What You’ll Do:


  • With guidance, support the Mission & Process Analytics organization in advanced data analytics and the development of qualitative and quantitative models to extract information from data for data discovery.
  • Share current advances in data analytics, gained from university coursework or experiences, with team members to improve data analysis and applications for Ball Aerospace.
  • Learn the art of consulting with business units, process owners, engineers and other subject matter experts to understand their data analytic needs & provide analysis recommendations and/or results.
  • Collaborate with and support team members in creating, applying, and improving process measures of effectiveness. Learn how data analytics are used to measure performance and inform corrective action.
  • Support projects of various impact and difficulty requiring developing analytic skills: continuous improvement methodology, statistical process control, forming valued metrics, data manipulation and processing of confidential data, modeling techniques, and dashboard development (using Power BI, R/Python, and Denodo)
  • Use an innate curiosity to investigate new data sources, ask probing data quality questions, and strive to provide excellent customer service to Ball Aerospace business units. Establish and maintain effective working relationships within the department, the Strategic Business Units, Strategic Support Units and the Company.
  • With guidance, learn the art of the possible, how to influence and defend business cases that support the use of data analytics to meet business unit strategic goals or business needs.
  • Maintain a regular and predictable work schedule.
  • Establish and maintain effective working relationships within the department, the Strategic Business Units, Strategic Support Units and the Company. Interact appropriately with others in order to maintain a positive and productive work environment.
  • Perform other duties as necessary.


What You’ll Need:


  • Must have completed your sophomore or junior year and be enrolled in a degree program for the fall of 2021. We will also accept students enrolled in a post graduate program.
  • Degree must be from a university, college, or school which is accredited by an agency recognized by the US Secretary of Education, US Department of Education.
  • Majoring in data science, mathematics, statistics, operations research, computer science, or a related technical field is preferred.
  • Concentration in data analytics preferred.
  • A strong desire to learn and excellent work ethic.
  • Good interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in a team and solo environment.
  • Proficiency in MS Office tools and knowledge of Python/R/SQL/SAS/STATA/SPSS/PowerBI.
  • A desire to develop business acumen with a strong balance between the business needs and process implementation.
  • Ability to contribute during all phases of a project: generating or understanding a hypothesis, evaluating data needs and expectations; manipulating data to provide appropriate data sets and results; and reaching conclusions against the hypothesis.
  • Knowledge of structured & unstructured data and, with guidance, a willingness to try various approaches to solve engineering hypotheses.
  • To develop and give presentations, reports, and documentation of work.
  • Openness to interpersonal growth experiences such as: maintaining composure in a difficult situation, holding crucial conversations, the desire for continuous forward progress on a project, and focusing on the solution in the face of adversity.
  • Some process improvement or project management experience is preferred.
  • Penchant for problem-solving and troubleshooting is preferred.


Working Conditions:

  • Work is performed in an office environment, laboratory, cleanroom, or production floor.
  • Travel and local commute between Ball campuses and other possible non-Ball locations may be required.


Relocation for this position is available.


Compensation & Benefits:


  • HIRING SALARY RANGE:     $19.30 - $27.50 per hour (Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.)
  • Temporary positions typically are not eligible for benefits. For details, copy and paste https://bit.ly/3pNSnxv into your browser or visit our careers site.

position: Physics/ Science/ Mechanical Engineering – Summer Intern – DOD Programs
description:
Peraton is seeking a Physics/Science/Mechanical Engineering Summer Intern to support our U.S. Navy Strategic Programs in Colorado Springs, Colorado.

For more than 60 years, Peraton has supported the U.S. Navy by performing research, development, analysis, modeling and simulation, test and evaluation to assess weapon system performance and qualify weapon systems for normal and hostile environments.

As an Intern, you will join the project team to learn and provide technical support for our ongoing, fast-paced, hypersonic research, development, test and evaluation efforts. You will have the opportunity to use commercial software and Peraton-developed software simulation tools to support and deliver timely analysis results for the U.S. Navy.
Assist Physicists, Engineers, and Software Developers in technical work pertinent to the team to which you are assigned
Support a team in the completion of materials characterization testing and qualification for use in hostile and atmospheric reentry environments

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:
A High School diploma and are entering your junior or senior year as a student pursuing a BS in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics at an accredited university offering a 4-year degree program
Experience with MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, and MS Word
Academic experience with any of: Python, MatLab, C++
Ability to obtain a DOD security clearance, which requires a U.S. citizen

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
A GPA of 3.0 or higher
Basic hardware and software hands-on development experience
Basic system integration and testing experience
Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to be detail-oriented and to prioritize work and meet quick turnaround deadlines

Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act:
The yearly compensation range for this role is: Minimum - $29,299 to Maximum - $45,780.
The successful candidate will be offered a yearly compensation that aligns with their individual skills and experience as it directly relates to the position requirements.
In addition to the yearly salary, Peraton provides a variety of benefits to include: health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world’s leading mission capability integrator, we are a trusted provider of highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies, including the Intelligence Community, Department of Defense, Department of Health and Human Services, and NASA. Every day, our 10,000 employees do the can’t be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.

The Emmes Company, LLC is a private Contract Research Organization (CRO). By giving our customers and partners, some of which are Fortune Global 500 companies across all industries, the most flexible commerce platform, which is based on a Microservices, API-first, true cloud, and headless architecture (we call it the MACH architecture*), we are not only helping them maintain their competitive advantage but we are also changing the e-commerce platform market. Founded in Germany in 2006, our international expansion has reached Europe, the US and Asia Pacific. In October 2019, with a $145M investment from global venture capital and private equity firm Insight Partners, commercetools is in full gear going forward.

PRODUCT INTERN (RFP)

When large enterprises buy software, they often resort to putting Request for Proposals (RFPs) out, which are long questionnaires full of questions that help the buyer to evaluate options from different software vendors. Buyers can then evaluate different vendors head to head, using the same criteria. Unfortunately, the RFPs that buyers often use are badly outdated. We at commercetools invented an entirely modern approach to commerce that is not reflected well in RFPs. In 2018, we built ModernCommerceRFP.com which is a website used to generate RFPs for modern commerce. It's been use hundreds of times by large enterprises to generate RFPs and is widely seen as the standard for modern RFPs. We would like an intern to work directly for our Chief Product Officer to give ModernCommerceRFP.com a major refresh and expand it into adjacent products such as content and search.

In this internship, you would work with commercetools senior management to define the scope of the new ModernCommerceRFP.com, work with commercetools employees and partners to define update/extend the list of RFP questions, add the questions to the website, thoroughly test the functionality, and then lead a campaign to publicize its re-launch.

SKILLS + QUALIFICATIONS

  • Pursuing degrees in business and computer science
  • Ability to analyze RFPs (50% of role)
  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal (35% of role)
  • Light web development skills (15% of role)
  • Proactive approach to problem solving and excellent interpersonal skills

Check out our Career Page and our Website for more information.

We know success comes from the hard work and dedication of our passionate and creative employees.

Are you ready? Come grow with us!
